definition: lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: Our army won victory in the first battle.
sentences.chinese: 這個戰役，我軍旗開得勝。

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the National College Entrance Examination.
sentences.chinese: 祝賀您今年高考旗開得勝，金榜題名。

sentences.english: Yeah you're right we're both totally striking out.
sentences.chinese: 耶，你是對的，我們旗開得勝了。

sentences.english: One time, I took on the whole class and won.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，我代表全班出戰，並且旗開得勝。

sentences.english: "Well, " he said, "I had a great trip. "
sentences.chinese: “你知道嗎？”他說，“我這一趟旗開得勝。”

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the national college entrance examination. I beg you to take this little gift as a souvenir.
sentences.chinese: 恭賀高考旗開得勝，奉上禮物以作紀念。

sentences.english: Ultimately, he says, his law will prevail.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他說道他的法案會旗開得勝的。

sentences.english: Hoover’s indecisiveness handed his successor a triumph at the very start of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 胡佛的優柔寡斷讓他的繼任得以在履新伊始旗開得勝。

sentences.english: My degree enabled me to hit the ground running as soon as I graduated.
sentences.chinese: 我的學位讓我一畢業就旗開得勝。

definition: Vanuatu, country in the southwestern Pacific Ocean
treasure knife does not age (idiom); old but still vigorous
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
Rostov-on-Don, Russian river port and regional capital close to Sea of Azov (north of the Black Sea)
12-yard (sports)/penalty kick
to compete for first prize
to mess sth up/to screw up
Uzbek/abbr. for Uzbekistan
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
to be determined to win (idiom)
to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to intercept (military)
hat-trick (sports)
to charge and break through enemy lines
lit. the dragon wars, the tiger battles (idiom); fierce battle between giants
